author: The Telegraph
title: Win an amazing 17-night tour of South Africa
text: South Africa is often described as a world in one country; during this popular tour the country's remarkable canvases unfold before you. Discover the incredible wildlife of Kruger National Park, the mighty Drakensberg escarpment, the dramatic landscapes of the Garden Route and the magnificent Cape Coast. The Telegraph – in partnership with Saga Holidays – is offering readers the chance to enjoy exhilarating safaris in search of lions, leopards, elephants, rhinos and buffalo, along with the scenic mountain kingdom of Swaziland and the highlights of Cape Town on this incredible escorted tour. You’ll be picked up from your home by a courteous chauffeur and driven to Heathrow for your direct overnight flight to Johannesburg, where you’ll travel to Pretoria for an orientation tour of South Africa's administrative capital. Then you'll journey on to Kruger National Park, where you can look out for the 'big five' game animals during an included day of game viewing, and see the Drakensberg escarpment on an included tour. Travel through the 'Switzerland of Africa', Ezulwini, on your way to Jozini where you can cruise the waters of Lake Jozini, home to over 350 different bird species. Look forward to a cultural Zulu show at Shakaland, before flying from Durban to Port Elizabeth. Then discover the coastal forest of Tsitsikamma before travelling along the dramatic Garden Route, staying at Knysna and Arniston and visiting the Outeniqua Mountains, where you'll stop at an ostrich farm and ride a mountain railcar. Your tour concludes with three nights in Cape Town, which you can see on an included excursion. For your chance to win this fantastic prize, simply enter your details in the form below by midnight on 5 December 2015. Online Form - Win an amazing 17-night tour of South Africa
